meanings.definition: A family in which at least one parent has children from a previous relationship.
meanings.sent1: Many stepfamilies have both parents who bring children from their past families together.
meanings.sent2: Stepfamilies can be formed when a single parent marries someone who also has children.
meanings.sent3: In the park, the stepfamilies played together happily, blending their different family histories.
meanings.sent4: The stepfamilies intertwined like branches from different trees, creating a new family tree together.
meanings.sent5: The stepfamilies painted a beautiful picture of love and unity despite their different origins.

meanings.definition: The relationship between a stepparent and their stepchildren.
meanings.sent1: Building trust is crucial in the bond between stepfamilies and stepchildren.
meanings.sent2: The stepfamilies showed love and care towards each other, strengthening their connection.
meanings.sent3: The stepfamilies joked and laughed, creating a warm atmosphere in their home.
meanings.sent4: The bond between stepfamilies and stepchildren is like a bridge connecting two hearts.
meanings.sent5: The stepfamilies shared special moments that made their relationship stronger and more meaningful.

meanings.definition: The process of forming a family unit with stepchildren.
meanings.sent1: Joining stepfamilies requires patience and understanding from all family members.
meanings.sent2: The process of blending stepfamilies involves open communication and mutual respect.
meanings.sent3: The stepfamilies navigated through challenges together, growing closer with each obstacle overcome.
meanings.sent4: Forming stepfamilies is like putting together a puzzle with pieces from different sets.
meanings.sent5: The process of creating stepfamilies is a journey filled with love, adjustments, and new beginnings.
